TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
When listening to the traffic report on the radio you hear "Ã¢â‚¬Â¦the Kerbal lane is closedÃ¢â‚¬Â¦"

But they actually said "Ã¢â‚¬Â¦curbÃ¢â‚¬Â¦"
When you want to learn the Kerbal language.
I swear to God that I had a dram where the reputation bar actually read numbers instead of the graphic thingy its got now... but I'm not sure.
I dreamt that I could no longer earn science and funds in my save, where I had completed the tech tree. It was awful.
When you tell your friends about all your missions last night, even though they don't care about it.
When you start telling your physics teacher that the Karman line is at 70km
When you saw Kim Jong Un building a 'messenger of peace'.
When you have Earth as desktop background and you try to right click and turn the camera, thinking you're in map view over Kerbin.
When you spend more time writing up posts about your KSP missions than you actually spend doing the missions.

When you have Earth as desktop background and you try to right click and turn the camera, thinking you're in map view over Kerbin.

When you see any KSP picture and try to right click and turn the camera....I do that soooo much it isn't funny.

When you're driving down the road and you look over to see the road crews' staging area with various tubes, pipes, conduit, all scattered about and think "huh, looks like Bill had a bad landing".
When you treat the KSP Forum like Facebook/Twitter.

When you tell your friends about all your missions last night, even though they don't care about it.

Yep. This.
When you stop building rockets and start building replica planes, really any of the contraptions people come up with between space launches.
When you're heading out to meet up with someone and text them that you're "on final approach".
You know you play too much ksp when you go in to the gas station and you ask for 10 units of fuel and extra separatrons

when your wife (who has never played) corrects you on a maneuver after 19 hours of not sleeping (playing KSP) and brought your approach closer than you did...i cried a little...out of pride of course....*cough...

when you go to the KSP facebook group and post some stuff about space combat... and they're like "you can DO that?"

Or when you're doing a project with someone for school about battleships, and you start lecturing them on how space combat works in KSP.... XD

when you go to the KSP facebook group and post some stuff about space combat... and they're like "you can DO that?"

Or when you're doing a project with someone for school about battleships, and you start lecturing them on how space combat works in KSP.... XD

http://i.imgur.com/06Us5Ud.jpg

You mean with I-Beams and Solid Rocket Motors?

I've got a prototype Capital Ship destroyer made out of I-Beam technology...

(I spend too much time on the NBC thread now.)

When you derive an equation to calculate the minimum distance required to destroy a part of specified impact tolerance based on the mass of your projectile, and the thrust of the projectile.
You see the (thankfully unmanned) Antares rocket explode after eight seconds of flight and your first thought is "well, at least *they* made it off the launch pad".

You see the (thankfully unmanned) Antares rocket explode after eight seconds of flight and your first thought is "well, at least *they* made it off the launch pad".

When I saw that, my first thought was "Looks like they designed that rocked with KSP" and my second thought was "Whoever double-tapped the space bar, activating two stages, then hit X during liftoff is in for a fun explanation of these events".
When You're launching Duna missions by docking six rockets together in orbit and launching as one craft.
...your wife tells you off for not washing they dishes because you were busy making a mun base
I had a dream last night that someone made a missile to obliterate my Drekevak every time... It made me sad
When everyone in my family and most of my friends ask me how my KSP games are going. Even though most of them barely know anything about the game.

I had a dream last night that someone made a missile to obliterate my Drekevak every time... It made me sad

not just a dream anymore zekes my friend i just cant publish it now because time.....when you see the latest fail from NASA and think that they should have not tested that design in KSP
